title: Ticket #2253: Schedd crash if parallel job disappears during negotiation
description:
During negotiation, if a job handled by the dedicated scheduler leaves the queue between the time the schedd sends it to the negotiator and when the negotiator replies with a match, the schedd will crash when it tries to retrieve the now-absent job ad from the ClassAdCollection.

Here's a stack trace provided by LIGO:

remarks:
2011-Jun-17 14:59:28 by danb:
I pushed a patch suitable for 7.6.2 for this problem. Someone with deeper knowledge of the dedicated scheduler may want to make DedicatedScheduler::scheduler_handleMatch() do something smarter when the job that requested a match has gone away. However, that work could probably be left for the development series.

2011-Jul-11 12:56:21 by tannenba:
After trying a schedd patched with [22224] and [22228] below, LIGO's schedd was consisting shutting down with the following exception: 
06/29/11 14:54:18 (pid:14742) Received TCP command 443 (RELEASE_CLAIM)
from unauthenticated@unmapped <10.14.2.93:58308>, access level READ
06/29/11 14:54:18 (pid:14742) Calling HandleReq <release_claim> (0)
06/29/11 14:54:18 (pid:14742) Got RELEASE_CLAIM from <10.14.2.93:58308>
06/29/11 14:54:18 (pid:14742) ERROR deleting match record for cluster
40221824
06/29/11 14:54:18 (pid:14742) Allocation node for this cluster doesn't
include the match rec
06/29/11 14:54:18 (pid:14742) ERROR "Can't delete m_rec from allocation
node for cluster 40221824" at line 3261 in file
/u/j/f/jfrey/condor/CONDOR_SRC/src/condor_schedd.V6/dedicated_scheduler.cpp

Upon looking at the below patches and the above exception, Nathan P concluded that perhaps the problem is DelMrec does not look in the pending queues for a matching record, and thus suggested the following patch: 

src/condor_schedd.V6/dedicated_scheduler.cpp |   23 +++++++++++++++++++++--
 1 files changed, 21 insertions(+), 2 deletions(-)

diff --git a/src/condor_schedd.V6/dedicated_scheduler.cpp b/src/condor_schedd.V6/dedicated_scheduler.cpp
index 49889d1..6c47e0d 100644
--- a/src/condor_schedd.V6/dedicated_scheduler.cpp
+++ b/src/condor_schedd.V6/dedicated_scheduler.cpp
@@ -3185,7 +3185,7 @@ DedicatedScheduler::DelMrec( match_rec* rec )
 bool
 DedicatedScheduler::DelMrec( char const* id )
 {
-	match_rec* rec;
+	match_rec* rec = NULL;

 	char name_buf[256];
 	name_buf[0] = '\0';
@@ -3195,7 +3195,26 @@ DedicatedScheduler::DelMrec( char const* id )
 				 "match not deleted\n" );
 		return false;
 	}
-
+	// Check pending_matches
+	std::map<std::string,match_rec*>::iterator it;
+	if((it = pending_matches.find(id)) != pending_matches.end()){
+		rec = it->second;
+		dprintf( D_FULLDEBUG, "Found record for claim %s in pending matches\n",id);
+		pending_matches.erase(it);
+		std::map<std::string,ClassAd*>::iterator rit;
+		if((rit = pending_requests.find(rec->publicClaimId())) != pending_requests.end()){
+			if(rit->second){
+				delete rit->second;
+				pending_requests.erase(rit);
+			}
+		}
+		std::map<std::string,std::string>::iterator cit;
+		if((cit = pending_claims.find(rec->publicClaimId())) != pending_claims.end()){
+			pending_claims.erase(cit);
+		}
+		delete rec;
+		return true;
+	}
 		// First, delete it from our table hashed on ClaimId.
 	HashKey key( id );
 	if( all_matches_by_id->lookup(key, rec) < 0 ) {

2011-Jul-11 13:22:43 by jfrey:
Nathan's patch looks correct, though I don't see any direct connection with Dan's patches. It is a bug related to asynchronous negotiation and should be committed.
